intro: Gaimardia amblyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom from late winter to early spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky shorelines. Gaimardia amblyphylla is adapted to salt spray and is an important part of the local coastal ecosystem.
